alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 10:22PM CDT until May 28 at 2:52AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska...Kansas... Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs affecting Decatur and Red Willow Counties. .Flooding continues to be a threat for much of Southwest Nebraska and far Northwest Kansas. Another round of rainfall is approaching the warning area from the west. If additional heavy rainfall occurs, that may lead to another minor rise in river stages late tonight or some time Saturday, especially in Southwest Nebraska. For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Beaver Creek At Cedar Bluffs. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowland areas in the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 16.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 06/12/1983. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding and do not drive through flood waters. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1030 AM CDT.
